Post.title: bash
Post._content:
# 

linux deploycrash

## 1. PID

PIDxxx.pidPID

bash\!\$ ShellProcessPID

Example:

```bash
#!/bin/bash
java -jar myapp.jar & echo $! > ./pid.file &
```

 myapp.jarPID, ./pid.file

## 2. 

 kill -0 
kill -0 \$pid-0PIDPID\$pid01

```bash
PID=$(cat ./pid.file) > /dev/null 2>&1
kill -0 ${SAUNA_PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
IS_RUNNING=$?
```

## 3. 

start.sh

```bash
#!/bin/bash
PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/app.pid
WATCH_PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/watch.pid

#PID
java -jar myapp.jar & echo $! > ${PID_FILE} 2>/dev/null &
sleep 5

sh watch.sh > watch.log 2>&1 &

echo $! > ${PID_FILE}


```

watch.sh

```bash
#!/bin/bash
PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/app.pid

if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]
then
#PID
  PID=$(cat ${SAUNA_PID_FILE}) > /dev/null 2>&1
  kill -0 ${PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
  IS_RUNNING=$?
else
  PID="0000"
  IS_RUNNING=1
fi

#
while true
do
  # 5 
  sleep 5
  if [ ${IS_RUNNING} -ne 0 ] ; then
    echo "service is dead. restarting...";
    sh start.sh
    exit 0;
  fi
  kill -0 ${PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
  IS_RUNNING=$?
done

```

**** stopkillwatch.sh
Post.raw:
---

## 2.

```bash
PID=$(cat ./pid.file) > /dev/null 2>&1
kill -0 ${SAUNA_PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
IS_RUNNING=$?
```

## 3. 

start.sh

```bash
#!/bin/bash
PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/app.pid
WATCH_PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/watch.pid

#PID
java -jar myapp.jar & echo $! > ${PID_FILE} 2>/dev/null &
sleep 5

sh watch.sh > watch.log 2>&1 &

echo $! > ${PID_FILE}


```

watch.sh

```bash
#!/bin/bash
PID_FILE=${HOME}/pids/app.pid

if [ -f "$PID_FILE" ]
then
#PID
  PID=$(cat ${SAUNA_PID_FILE}) > /dev/null 2>&1
  kill -0 ${PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
  IS_RUNNING=$?
else
  PID="0000"
  IS_RUNNING=1
fi

#
while true
do
  # 5 
  sleep 5
  if [ ${IS_RUNNING} -ne 0 ] ; then
    echo "service is dead. restarting...";
    sh start.sh
    exit 0;
  fi
  kill -0 ${PID} > /dev/null 2>&1
  IS_RUNNING=$?
done

```

```text
$-

$@
"$@"""$1" "$2"  "$n"

Shell

$1$n
Shell$11$22
```

Post.title: ElasticSearchsecrity
Post._content:
# 1. /etc/security/limits.conf

/etc/security/limits.conf

```bash
[username] soft nofile 102400
[username] hard nofile 102400
[username] soft nproc 2048
[username] hard nproc 2048
[username] soft memlock unlimited
[username] hard memlock unlimited
```



```bash
ulimit -a 
```

# 2. max_map_count

```bash
vim /etc/sysctl.conf
vm.max_map_count=262144
```



``` bash
sysctl -p
```

@Configuration
public class WebConfig extends WebMvcConfigurationSupport {
@Override
protected void addArgumentResolvers(List argumentResolvers) {

}
}

Post.title: linux
Post._content:
# 1. 

## 1.1 fdisk

1

```bash
fdisk -l
```

2 

```bash
fdisk /dev/sdb
```

3

### 1.2  parted

## 2. 

```bash
mkfs.ext4 /dev/sdb1  
```

## 3. 

1) /data/data

```bash
mkdir /data  
```

2

```bash
mount /dev/sdb1 /data  
```

## 4. UUID

```bash
1. $ sudo blkid  
```



```bash
/dev/sda1: UUID="8048997a-16c9-447b-a209-82e4d380326e" TYPE="ext4"
/dev/sda5: UUID="0c5f073a-ad3f-414f-85c2-4af83f6a437f" TYPE="swap"
/dev/sdb1: UUID="11263962-9715-473f-9421-0b604e895aaa" TYPE="ext4"
/dev/sr0: LABEL="Join Me" TYPE="iso9660" 
```

## 5. 
mount/etc/fstab

```bash
sudo vim /etc/fstab  
```



```bash
UUID=11263962-9715-473f-9421-0b604e895aaa /data ext4 defaults 0 1
```

```bash

<fs spec> <fs file> <fs vfstype> <fs mntops> <fs freq> <fs passno>
/dev/sdb1:
<fs spec> :
UUIDLABELUUID=6E9ADAC29ADA85CDLABEL=software
<fs file> : /data
<fs vfstype> : linuxext4windowsntfs
<fs mntops> : defaults
<fs freq> : 0
<fs passno> : 0, 
```

/etc/fstabsudo mount -a

Post.title: SSH
Post._content:
SSH
 HOST 

# 



```bash
ssh $HOST ls
```

; (inlined, separated with ;)

```bash
ssh $HOST ls; pwd; cat /path/to/remote/file
```

sudo

```bash
ssh $HOST sudo ls /root
sudo: no tty present and no askpass program specified
```

sudo shell,  -t 

```bash
ssh -t $HOST sudo ls /root
[sudo] password for zaiste:
```

# 

```bash
VAR1="Variable 1"
ssh $HOST '
ls
pwd
if true; then
    echo "True"
    echo $VAR1      # <-- it won't work
else
    echo "False"
fi
'
```

shell $VAR1

# 

bash -c 

```bash
VAR1="Variable 1"
ssh $HOST bash -c "'
ls
pwd
if true; then
    echo $VAR1
else
    echo "False"
fi
'"
```

# 

stdin

```output
cat script.sh
ls
pwd
hostname
```

```bash
ssh $HOST < script.sh
```

# Heredoc

**heredoc**


```bash
VAR1="boo"
ssh -T $HOST << EOSSH
ls
pwd
if true; then
  echo $VAR1
else
  echo "False"
fi
EOSSH
```

heredocheredoc

```bash
ssh -T $HOST <<'EOSSH'
VAR1=`pwd`
echo $VAR1

VAR2=$(uname -a)
echo $VAR2

EOSSH
```



```output
Pseudo-terminal will not be allocated because stdin is not a terminal.
```

ssh -T 

# 

[here](https://zaiste.net/a_few_ways_to_execute_commands_remotely_using_ssh/)
